articles.title: T20 World Cup 2026: Under-Fire Australia Relying on 'Luck of The Irish'
articles.description: Following an abject 23-run defeat to world number 11 Zimbabwe, Australia crashed to an eight-wicket loss to co-hosts Sri Lanka in Kandy on Monday to be pushed to the brink of a humiliating exit
articles.content:

articles.title: Zimbabwe Tames Inflation, Now the Test Is Keeping It Below 10%
articles.description: Zimbabwe’s annual inflation rate has fallen below 10% for the first time since 1997, a milestone for a nation once synonymous with hyperinflation and trillion-dollar banknotes. The question now is whether the stability can last.
articles.content:

articles.title: Sri Lanka's Historic Win Over Australia: A Landmark at T20 World Cup 2026
articles.description: Sri Lanka triumphed over Australia by eight wickets at the Pallekele Stadium, thanks to Pathum Nissanka's 52-ball century, the first against Australia in T20 World Cups. This win secured Sri Lanka's spot in Super Eights and pushed Australia toward possible elimination depending on Zimbabwe's performance against Ireland.
articles.content: In a riveting clash at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, Sri Lanka overpowered Australia by eight wickets at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, entering the Super Eights and nearly sealing Australia's fate for elimination. The victory, spar... [913 chars]

articles.title: Australia to qualify for Super 8s? Full T20 World Cup 2026 qualification scenarios for all teams revealed
articles.description: After back-to-back losses for the Australian side against Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka, their chances of qualification have been dimmed by an awkward margin. With 10 teams still in contention for the remaining three spots in the ICC T20 World Cup Super-8s, here is a detailed view of the qualification scenarios of the teams.

articles.title: T20 World Cup: Nissanka's ton helps Sri Lanka break multiple records en route to historic win over Australia
articles.description: Nissanka's unbeaten century was the second hundred by a Sri Lankan batter in the T20 World Cups. The first ton was hit by former captain Mahela Jayawardene (100) against Zimbabwe in the 2010 edition.
